page.title: 16 SHEEP FARM NEAR WOODBRIDGE.
page.content: Overlooking the River Deben are the 350 Acres of Hill Farm. Half of the farm has pastureland for 900 sheep. One shepherd cares for the 350 ewes 8 rams and 542 lambs.Most of the lambs were born between January and March. Some times the farmer or his shepherd stays up all night to look after the baby lambs. The sheep are dipped twice a year.This is to stop them from getting the germs of sheep scab in their fleece. They did not like being dipped and the shepherd had to shove them into the pit, then the farmer pushed them under the disinfectant. The shepherd has two dogs to help him, heir names are short ones {Meg and Joe so that the shepherd can call them easily.
